case_vignette: A 65-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 2-month history of persistent pain in her right shoulder. The pain is localized to the top of the shoulder and is worse with movement. She has stiffness in the right shoulder that is worse in the morning and usually lasts 20 minutes. The patient reports that she is unable to brush her hair and has stopped going to her regular tennis lessons because of the pain. She does not recall any fall or trauma. When her right arm is passively abducted in an arc, there is pain between 60 and 120 degrees of abduction. When asked to lower the right arm slowly from 90 degrees of abduction, she is unable to hold her arm up and it drops to her side. Passive range of motion is normal. Injection of 5 mL of 1% lidocaine into the right subacromial space does not relieve the pain or improve active range of motion of the right arm.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having persistent pain in my right shoulder for the last two months, it gets worse when I move it, and I'm also experiencing stiffness, especially in the morning.
How old are you?
I am 65 years old.
Have you experienced any recent injuries or trauma to your right shoulder?
No, I don't recall any fall or trauma.
Do you have a history of any autoimmune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, or psoriasis?
The vignette does not provide information about my history of autoimmune diseases.
Do you have a family history of any autoimmune diseases or other rheumatologic conditions?
The vignette does not mention any family history of autoimmune diseases or rheumatologic conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications for your symptoms?
The vignette does not specify any medications that I am taking for my symptoms.
**Final Diagnosis:** Adhesive Capsulitis (Frozen Shoulder)
